New Records: Adolis García set a record for RBIs in a postseason series with 15
García’s home run streak is tied for fourth-longest in postseason history
Key Match Events: Corey Seager homered in the first inning
Adolis García homered twice and drove in five runs
García led the charge with a four-run fourth that featured a two-run double by rookie Evan Carter and a two-run single by García
Alex Bregman hit a solo homer in the bottom of the third inning
García added a solo shot in the eighth inning
Pre-Game Insights: Bruce Bochy became the first skipper to win a League Championship Series with three different teams
Bochy spearheaded a swift turnaround with Texas, making its first playoff appearance since 2016
Post-Match Reflections: Adolis García seemed to delight in playing the road villain
Houston manager Dusty Baker said, 'I don’t like tipping my cap to anybody. But when someone beats the hell out of you, what are you going to do?'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers scored three runs in the first inning and kept increasing their lead
Jordan Montgomery pitched in relief and picked up the Game 7 win
Max Scherzer allowed four hits and two runs with two walks in 2 2/3 innings
Cristian Javier lost a playoff start for the first time, after entering the game 4-0 with a 0.82 ERA in four career postseason starts
